channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2024040040
item.description:
Report E-2024040040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: MADISONVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/30/2024, at 11:12 hours, personnel in the CSXT Atkinson Yard in Madisonville, KY, reported GATX93341, a loaded tank car of Fluorosilicic Acid leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Simplot Phosphates, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #20240330-00051). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the release was due to a faulty pressure relief device; the vent assembly was found with no rupture disc, surge protection sleeve, or rupture disc retaining ring. Additionally, the threads utilized for installing a rupture disc retention ring into the assembly base were broken. MEI personnel removed the faulty pressure relief device and replaced with an in-kind assembly to temporarly secure the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Anthony Guillen 208-780-0794). The car was held out of transportation at Madisonville, KY pending additional repair by a certified car shop.

item.title: Report X-2024041001
item.description:
Report X-2024041001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS LEAKING DIET DR PEPPER DRINKING SODA. DURING PACKAGE REWRAP WE DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING. THIS BOX CONTAINED (4) X 170 ML (5.7 OZ) FLAMMABLE CLARK SHAVING COMPANY REFILL CARTRIDGES FOR A BRAUN CLEAN RENEW CCR CLEANING SYSTEM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024040937
item.description:
Report X-2024040937

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO A TRIGGER TERM OF FLAMMABLE ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE OLYMPUS 600-BAT-L 52 WH LI-ION BATTERY INSIDE THE BOX. THE BATTERY IS PACKAGED WITH FOUR FLAMMABLE AEROSOL PRODUCTS CLASSIFIED AS UN1950, AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE, 2.1. TWO OF THE FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS ARE MAGNAFLUX SPOTCHECK SKL-SP2. TWO ARE MAGNAFLUX SPOTCHECK SKD-S2. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE FIFTEEN X TWELVE OUNCE BOTTLES OF ULTRASONIC COUPLANT THAT APPEAR NOT TO BE REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. THE CAPS ON A FEW OF THESE BOTTLES WERE LOOSE AND APPEAR TO HAVE LEAKED WITHIN THE BOX VISIBLE BY RESIDUE ON THE OUTER BOTTLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024040802
item.description:
Report X-2024040802

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was dropped causing the bottom of the drum to crack. We cleaned the spill with absorbent pads. We secured the hazmat and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: The bottom of the drum cracked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed upside down in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040791
item.description:
Report X-2024040791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a spill, once admin arrived it was found that a plastic pail with hazmat diamonds on it was crushed under packages and leaking onto dock floor causing the spill. DescribePack: Side of plastic pail was cracked due to too much weight being on the plastic pail allowing a crack to develop and contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic pail was immediately put into a lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in its transport trailer with a large wet stain already on it. Package handlers were told to leave the truck and and package was properly relocated. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 gallon jugs inside did not have a fully screwed on top cap DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved to a safe location
